div1.head: Letter from [Howard A. Kelly] to A.N. Tasker, October 25, 1922
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your
exceedingly satisfactory and explicit letter, giving
me just the information I want. I take it from this
that you must have the correct spelling of Miss Maass'
name, with two a's and two s's. The statement is,
also, I think, substantially correct.

I shall be very glad indeed to
have Mr. Reeves make me the best copy of General
Sternberg's portrait that is possible, to be used
in the next edition of my life of Walter Reed, in
which there will be a chapter on Sternberg and one
on Gorgas.

I am sorry to hear that Mrs. Reed
has not had the increased pension. I believe that
the amount she was to receive monthly is $333. In
addition, she has, of course, the income from the
Walter Reed fund during life, which is a substantial
addition. This fact may have been considered by
Congress. If any injustice, however, is done her,
it will quite certainly be readily corrected by the
aggressive interest of an interested friend on whatever
committee onsiders such things. Won't you kindly
let me have Mrs. Reed's address.
